definition: not understanding things (idiom); devoid of sense
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
unable to distinguish right and wrong (idiom)
to fail to see the larger issue (idiom)/to fail to grasp the big picture
not knowing when to come or leave (idiom); with no sense of propriety
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
fair and reasonable (idiom); sensible/standing to reason
completely lacking any feeling or sense of justice (idiom); cold and ruthless
